description:
The Athletic's Fantasy Premier League expert Mark McGettigan - aka FPL General - gets straight to the point and tells you what you need to know if you want to be a successful FPL manager.
Transfer advice, captaincy picks, a regularly updated watchlist, this is the pod for you if you want to rise to the top of your mini league and stay there.

items.content:
The General gives his thoughts on the upcoming blank and double gameweeks. With only one fixture in the next two gameweeks, could this be the week to transfer out Erling Haaland? The General gives his recommendations on potential temporary replacements and answers your twitter questions.

items.content:
The General looks ahead to the final Gameweek of the season, as he tries to push into the overall top 10k, and details various strategies to help you triumph in your mini-leagues...
Plus answers to the following:

Are hits in the final Gameweek worth it?

Would you swap out Salah for Son or Mane as a punt? 

Is it worth doing a -4 for Salah to Son, or just do a straight swap of Salah to KDB?

Best Coutinho replacement?

Differential players to consider for the final gameweek of the season if you are chasing? 

Probably going to transfer Salah to Son, but also tempted to do either Saka to Bowen or Mount to Diaz for a -4. Should I just play safe with the one transfer?

Still have the triple captain chip left, should I place it on Son or KDB? 

Do you think there will be any changes to the game (chips, etc) next season?

Any tips that we should do to prepare for a new season ahead?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Stick or twist with Salah?

items.content:
FPL General is here to look ahead to double gameweek 36 as we approach the business end of the FPL season. He's got an update on his watchlist, transfer advice and captaincy picks, plus these questions answered:

With the rotation risk ahead of the cup final, should we transfer out our Chelsea assets for other DGW starters?

Hold James? Or move to Dias for double city defence?

Keep or sell Mount?

Are there any Chelsea players you’d include on a free hit this week based on current form?

Should we move Chelsea assets to Man City ones even if it’s for a hit?

Is Mount to Foden worth a hit?

Is KDB the best differential captain this week and is it better to go for Foden or Laporte on a Free Hit?

For those of us that went Dewsbury-Hall in recent weeks, is it worth a -4 to move to Gordon due to security of starts in the upcoming doubles?  

Is it worth removing Kulusevski for another mid-price option with better fixtures but less certainty of minutes such as Foden or Maddison? 

Depending on minutes and fitness tomorrow I really like a punt on Vardy. Is he forgotten?

Is it worth transferring Ramsdale for any other keeper at this stage of the season?

Is free hit a given even if you have 9 players playing twice?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Deciding which teams to big on for double gameweek 36

items.content:
FPL General is here ahead of Saturday's gameweek 35 deadline with some last minute advice to help you push on record a strong end to the FPL season as we enter the closings stages.

Do I sell James for Cancelo?

Replace Reece James with Laporte or Alonso and is Matty Cash a good buy for upcoming fixtures?

Which Chelsea players are most likely to be rotated against Everton? Worth selling Werner and Havertz/Mount for Watkins and Coutinho?

Is Ramsey a good Villa asset to bring in to attack their upcoming fixtures, if you're tight on funds? Him or Dewsbury-Hall as a cheap midfielder?

Who is the better buy for the rest of the season... Foden or Coutinho? Or, hold Havertz and re-evaluate next week with two FT's before the double?

Sell Sterling for Son or go without Spurs players for the run-in?

Is a triple up on Arsenal attackers a viable option with the players being Saka, Odegaard and Nketiah?

Would you consider Zaha? Playing the worst defence in Southampton next followed by another poor defence in Watford followed by a decent double in 37?

Best Broja replacements? Need a striker for bench boost on DGW36?

Would it be safe to double up on Man City and Liverpool defenders?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
With just five gameweeks left until the end of the season the FPL General is here to help you try and eek out that last bit of improvement that could see you rise up the mini-leagues. He's got a review of gw34, a watchlist update, captaincy advice and answers to these questions:

What should we do with Reece James?

Who are the best Man City assets to have for the rest of the season?

Raheem Sterling - Should we keep the faith?

Would you move Havertz/Mount to Foden for GW35?

No shot on target for Spurs in the last two games. Should we hold Son/Kane or move to a KDB?

Best differentials to catch up in mini-leagues as well as getting to desired rank at the end of the season?

Who are the best budget striker options for the upcoming DGW36 if you are on a Bench Boost?

If I have to drop one of Trent or Robertson to make my bench boost work, which one should it be?

What’s your preferred gameweek to Free Hit - 36 or 37?

items.content:
FPL General looks ahead to gameweek 34, reflects on a mixed bag for many managers in gw33, and answers these questions:

Is it safe to transfer out Saka for a Chelsea midfielder?

Should we chase the next possible haul by getting Werner or go safe with Havertz and Mount?

Would Reece James playing as a right sided centre back put you off bringing him in on wildcard?

Rate the Top 3 assets from Chelsea please?

Is it worth selling Coutinho for Mount?

Are Leicester midfielders a sell despite their double/double in gw36/37?

Would you be tempted by Sadio Mane over a City attacker?

Ederson or Mendy?

Who is the best sub 5m midfielder from now until the end of the season?

If planning to WC35, what one-week punts to go for?

items.title: Chelsea players for double gameweek 34 - gamble with Werner or play safe with Mount?

items.content:
FPL General is on hand with some last minute help ahead of Saturday's gameweek 33 deadline. He's got up-to-date team news, captaincy picks, transfer advice, plus answers to these questions:

Is Cornet, who is guaranteed a start, a better midfield option than the Leicester players, Maddison, Barnes, etc. who will be subject to rotation?

Should I sell Barnes for Maddison who’s in much better form, or are both rotation risks in equal measure due to conference league involvement?

Best Leicester defender? 

Should we sell one of our premium assets (Salah/Son/Kane) for Bruno/Ronaldo?

Your opinion on Sancho if Bruno is unaffordable?

Is the Bruno two week punt for Salah worth it? 

Which is the best defence to double up on? Liverpool, Chelsea, or City?

Do we keep Coutinho now with the possible DGW for AVL in GW35?

Out of these 3 forwards: Broja, Adams & Weghorst, which one would you replace first? 

Free Hit question - should you go all DGWers or mix it with SGWers who have good fixtures?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: FPL Friday - Time to swap Salah for Bruno?

items.content:
FPL General looks ahead to gameweek 33 and it's another big one with plenty of teams playing twice, and a few not playing at all.
There's also a quick review of gw32, a watchlist update, plus these questions answered:

Best Doherty replacements?

With Doherty out for the season, is it worthwhile just going sideways to either Emerson or Reguilon?

If you don't own Son but you own Kane, Kulusevski and Doherty, does the Irishman’s injury present a must have opportunity to buy Son? Or is Kane & Kulusevski enough?

Is KDB now on the verge of becoming an essential, given his form and fixture run until the end of the season?

Is it time to remove Arsenal assets?

Which goalkeeper aside from the big three can we trust for the rest of the season?

Is it worth it to ship a DGW player (Broja/Weghorst) to Saint-Maximin/Wood for a -4?

Best picks on a Free Hit this week?

Which combination of DGWs is the best with two free hits left? 

Who are the stand out picks for triple captain between now and the end of the season?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Double gameweek 33 preview - finding the best replacements for Matt Doherty

items.content:
FPL General is here with a last-minute preview of gameweek 31 including some up-to-date team news and plenty of transfer advice via answers to these questions:

If we get the news that Trent Alexander-Arnold is not going to play against Watford, is it worth it to transfer him out? Then for who?

Which Chelsea defender to buy? James, Rudiger, Silva or Chalobah?

How much of a risk is bringing in Cancelo with an impending UCL fixture that Walker is suspended for?

Best Ramsdale replacement?

What to do with Coutinho? Put money in defence or get a Man City or Chelsea midfielder? 

Havertz vs Foden vs Mahrez. Best long term hold? 

Best strikers around the £5-6 million range?

Who are the must-have players on a GW31 wildcard?

I’m planning to free hit in GW33 and wildcard in GW34. With 2 frees I can punt on a player or two for GW31 and GW32, who would you suggest? 

Is going with two non-playing bench players too risky if we are loading up on players from the likes of City and Chelsea?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

What to do with Coutinho? Put money in defence or get a Man City or Chelsea midfielder? 

Havertz vs Foden vs Mahrez. Best long term hold? 

Best strikers around the £5-6 million range?

Who are the must-have players on a GW31 wildcard?

I’m planning to free hit in GW33 and wildcard in GW34. With 2 frees I can punt on a player or two for GW31 and GW32, who would you suggest? 

Is going with two non-playing bench players too risky if we are loading up on players from the likes of City and Chelsea?

items.title: Team news and transfer advice

items.content:
FPL General is here to get you back focused on your FPL team as we approach the end of the international break. He looks ahead to double gameweek 31 with his usual variety of advice on captaincy, transfers, players to add to the watchlist, plus answers for these questions:

Which Burnley assets (if any) would you be interested in bringing in for their DGW31 and future fixtures?

 What are your thoughts on having NO DGW players for this week?

 Is punting on Weghorst a good move?

 Thoughts on picking five defenders from Liverpool, City and Chelsea?

 Top 3 Man City assets and Top 3 Chelsea assets for the run-in?

 Is it time to sell Raphinha for a Leicester midfielder?

 Smith-Rowe to Saka for a hit?

 What do you think of Man United assets, particularly given DGW33. Would a FH in GW33 eliminate any need for Man United assets?

 With Ramsdale and Dubravka both in doubt, is Pope for a -4 a clever shout for GW31, given his doubles?

 For those with 1 FH left, which do you think of FH33 or FH36 is better?

items.title: Picking the best Man City & Chelsea assets for the run-in

items.content:
FPL General is here to help you navigate the choppy waters of gameweek 30 which sees only eight Premier League teams in action, plus there's an update on his watchlist, his captaincy picks and these questions answered:

If I have 9 BGW30 players, am I better to bank a transfer this week to have 2FTs for 31?

Is Salah to Son worth it for GW30? 

Is rotating Salah in and out for GW30 and 31 worth it. For example, Salah to Barnes for 30, then Coutinho to Salah in 31?

Is it worth selling Son to redistribute the funds?

Do we get Leicester defenders this week?

Can we genuinely ignore Burnley and Everton totally and only consider Leicester from GW33?

Under what circumstances is it acceptable to use your last FH this week?

How many players should be enough for BGW30?

Would you double/triple up on defences with the Free Hit or distribute the teams?

What are your favourite differential picks for those of us on a free hit for GW30 and looking to climb the rankings?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Navigating blank gameweek 30 - to free hit or not to free hit

items.content:
The FPL General picks up the pieces after a big double gameweek and looks ahead to another double in GW29 while also keeping an eye on the upcoming GW30 where a number of teams do not play. We've also got a watchlist update, captaincy advice, plus answers for these questions:

Who are the best assets from teams that play twice in DGW29 and don’t blank in BGW30?

Stuck with Son but want Kane. Is a Son and Jimenez to Kulusevski and Kane for a -4 worthwhile?

Would you sell Coutinho for Kulusevski?

Which one Spurs player to pick for the next 2 GWs, Doherty or Kulusevski?

Is it worth selling someone like Digne or Saiss ahead of GW29 for a Spurs defender (probably Doherty) for the extra fixture in 29 even though both Villa & Wolves do both play in 30?

With Spurs & Arsenal doubling in 29, playing in 30 & good fixtures going forward…are ‘big hits’ (-8,-12) justifiable if single game week players with poor fixtures (eg. Villa or teams blanking in 30) are being replaced?

If you owned Reece James, would you hold as he’s due back in GW31? Or sell him on? If so, who for?

Jota or Diaz to fill the Bowen spot in midfield?

How many and which Leicester assets do we need for the upcoming gameweeks?

Best Leicester defensive asset to bring in?

Is GW30 worthy of a Free Hit if you can only field 6-7 players or would it be better utilised later in the season for a big DGW?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Planning for Double Gameweek 29 and Blank Gameweek 30

items.content:
FPL General looks ahead to another double gameweek, with Chelsea being among the most appealing sides to target this week. The General has an updated watchlist, plenty of transfer and captaincy thoughts, plus answers to the these listener questions:

Best Chelsea assets to target for DGW 28? In particular, Rudiger v James.

 Would you sell Cancelo this week for a Chelsea defender?

 Can we go without TAA now with Robertson performing so well?

 Raphinha vs JWP - best choice for this week's double only? 

 Which is the best Newcastle midfielder for DGW28 and DGW29 - Fraser or Willock and why?

 Is Bowen to Raphinha a move worth doing despite Bowen now having a game in the blank week 30?

 Three tempting Southampton full backs, but each one a concern for minutes, is Bednarek the play?

 Best picks for people on a wildcard this week?

 Have two FHs still, the plan was always to use them in 30 and 33 but is there more upside to using one in 28?

 Which out of DGW28 or DGW29 would the bench boost chip be best activated?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Which Chelsea assets should we target for DGW 28?

items.content:
The FPL General reflects on a late decision to wildcard, following last Friday's fixture changes, and why he'll get over not triple-captaining 84 pt hero Mo Salah... Plus, why it makes sense to use a Free Hit chip for Gameweek 27 as well as, answers to the following:

Who are the best Triple Captain options, if you still haven't used it?

What's the minimum number of players you would say to play in BGW27?

I have six players from Liverpool & Arsenal, and 1 Free Hit... Would you FH this week and save your wildcard for next?

Should those of us on a Free Hit aim to have some bench cover or simply put as much money into our starting 11 as possible?

Are Burnley assets worth a hit this week if we don't plan on keeping them going forward?

Who are some of the best differential picks for a free hit squad?

Foden vs Sancho vs Sterling for the free hit selection?

Which Man City triple up to go for on Free Hit?

Do you go for Fernandes or Sancho from the Manchester United midfield on a free hit?

Could Podence be a sneaky differential in the upcoming weeks?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes.subtitle: The General reflects on an incredible night for Mo Salah owners who heeded his advice to triple-captain him last week... and it's not the end of the world if you didn't.
itunes.summary:
The FPL General reflects on a late decision to wildcard, following last Friday's fixture changes, and why he'll get over not triple-captaining 84 pt hero Mo Salah... Plus, why it makes sense to use a Free Hit chip for Gameweek 27 as well as, answers to the following:

Who are the best Triple Captain options, if you still haven't used it?

What's the minimum number of players you would say to play in BGW27?

I have six players from Liverpool & Arsenal, and 1 Free Hit... Would you FH this week and save your wildcard for next?

Should those of us on a Free Hit aim to have some bench cover or simply put as much money into our starting 11 as possible?

Are Burnley assets worth a hit this week if we don't plan on keeping them going forward?

Who are some of the best differential picks for a free hit squad?

Foden vs Sancho vs Sterling for the free hit selection?

Which Man City triple up to go for on Free Hit?

Do you go for Fernandes or Sancho from the Manchester United midfield on a free hit?

Could Podence be a sneaky differential in the upcoming weeks?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Salah Regret & Free Hit Gameweek 27

items.content:
FPL General reflects on gameweek 25 and casts his eyes upon the upcoming double gameweek 26 - with a host of teams playing twice it's another chance to rack up big points. There's transfer advice, captaincy picks, a watchlist update, plus these questions answered:

Is Salah triple captain still on this week after his slight dip in form following the African Cup of Nations?

 For those with Trent, Robertson & Jota, which one would be best to lose to accommodate Salah?

 If you have more than 4 fixtures being played by your bench players in Gw26, is boosting a preferable chip to TC?  


 Who would your top 3 Arsenal assets be and why?

 What should we do with Ronaldo?

 Best 3 strikers to navigate GW26 & 27 and beyond if not using a FH until GW30?

 Kane or Son or neither for the DGW?

 Who are the best 3 single GW options for the upcoming DGW26?

 Which Wolves defender/(s) would you target on a DGW26 Free Hit?

 Is it ok to bench Man City assets?

 Do we stick with Raphina given his benching and tough fixtures or move to someone like Saka?

 Which Burnley defender do you think is best as a punt for their two DGWs?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Is this the week to triple captain Salah?

items.content:
The midweek fixtures are in the books so FPL General is here to preview gameweek 25 with a tight turnaround to Saturday's 11am deadline. All the usual wisdom plus these questions answered:

Is it worth buying Bruno for the DGW or going straight to Salah?

Thoughts on bench boost in GW26 over TC Salah?

Is this a good time to wildcard without having Salah and a few players I’m not happy with?

What’s the plan to bring Salah back if I have KDB and Bruno?

Weghorst or Cornet to target for Burnley's double double?

Is Antonio to Weghorst the best move?

Should we replace Foden with Coutinho and is Dalot a good option going forward as a 5th defender?

What do you think about Raphinha, Watkins & Antonio?

Which five players should we be targeting for DGW26?

Edouard benched again. Should we admit we got it wrong and cut our losses? Or hold for the good run fixtures and have faith that he’ll return?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Do we get Salah straight back in?

items.content:
FPL General is back after a lengthy gameweek 23 finally drew to a close at the weekend, and it was a tough one for a lot of managers. We look ahead to gameweek 24 with the usual array of transfer advice, watchlist updates, and these questions answered:

What strategy would you go for with ALL CHIPS left to use?

How many hits is it worth taking for a Bench Boost, -4 or -8?

What do you think of Free Hit GW26 and have at least a strong 11 who all double, as opposed to the crowd of Triple Captain Salah as a part of a chip strategy?

Bruno. Salah. KdB. Ronaldo. Kane. Son. Which two or three do you see as the most effective from GWs 24-27?

With so many premium assets back in form, is it "essential", especially structure-wise, to have a two premium set up, or is it still viable to perma captain Salah and spread the cash?

Top 3 defenders to buy ahead of GW24 excluding Trent & Cancelo? Unlimited budget.

Is Rashford a viable alternative to Ronaldo and Bruno as a Man United attacking option for the next two gameweeks?

Are the Crystal Palace options worth a punt? Good recent underlying stats but mostly from home games…next 3 out of 4 fixtures are away…

Is it worth holding the Watford strikers for the upcoming DGW?

Is it worth thinking outside the box when looking for strikers? Benteke, Edouard, Richarlison for example?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Gameweek 24 midweek fixtures preview

items.content:
Utkarsh Dalmia aka @zophar666 joins the General in the latest series of interviews with elite FPL managers. 
Zophar started his FPL journey with a midfield featuring Lucas Leiva and Wilson Palacios. He's since had seven top 10,000 finishes and a career-high finish of 17th in the world! 
He discusses his selection and transfer policy that hasn't seen him finish lower than 52,916th since starting the game in 09/10

items.content:
FPL General's series of interviews with the top FPL managers continues with Craig aka FPL Editor - one of the best around, he can boast 7 top 20k seasons, including 3 top 5k finishes and is also the head writer at fantasyfootballfix.com
Among the subjects up for discussion there's a look at how Craig's approach to FPL has changed over the years since he started in 2011, his tips on cracking the magical top 10k mark, and there's advice on how best to deal with those dreaded bad gameweeks.

items.title: Interviewing the elite managers: FPL Editor

items.content:
FPL General is here after a hectic double gameweek featuring more postponements and plenty of on-field drama. We look ahead to GW23 with the usual selection of captaincy picks, transfer advice, a watchlist update, and these burning questions tackled:

With some shrewd signings are Villa assets worth a consideration?

 Is it better to focus on strong mid to long term transfers e.g. City assets or chase the immediate extra points from teams with doubles?

 Is it wise to sell Jota with a plan to replace him with Salah?

 With Fernandes appearing to find some form now and Ronaldo looking more out of sorts, is it time to just ditch Ronaldo and return to our old FPL best mate from last season, for a Bruno and Salah double up?

 Would you be holding onto Everton assets with Duncan Ferguson now at the reins or look to the more attractive midfielder options?

 What to do with Antonio?

 Selling Rudiger next week, is a Man City defender the best replacement despite no DGWs?

 Raphinha, Coutinho or Foden?

 With no DGW23 fixtures announced, are we better to bank a transfer this week if we can?

 How tempted are you to wildcard sooner rather than later?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The FPL General is back after the FA Cup break and ready to hit the ground running for the double gameweeks that lie ahead. There's all the usual transfer and captaincy talk, plus a watchlist update and these questions answered:

With Son out injured and Salah at AFCON, is it worth free hitting for the double gameweek coming up? Or should we save both FHs for later?

Is it mad to use the 2nd WC this week?

I'll be hitting the Wildcard this GW. What are some must have pics for the double that I will want to keep long term?

Do you think it's prudent to withhold from using any chips until things settle down?

Best Son replacements?  


Should we be looking at Wolves defenders and if so which one is your preference?

Given all the uncertainty I’m thinking of keeping Salah to save transferring him back. Views? 

If I have Salah & Son, should I hold Salah & use Son for replacements?

Is Dalot worth keeping? 

Do we still keep Foden or sell?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

In the first of a series of interviews with the best FPL managers in the world, The General talks strategy with a member of the elite - FPL Heisenberg.
With multiple top 10K finishes under his belt, including a best ever of 836th in the world, FPL Heisenberg shares his philosophy on transfer strategy, whether he feels stats or the "eye test" yields more FPL success, and which stats and tools to look out for when looking for future FPL prospects.

items.content:
The FPL General is here with his last podcast of 2021 ahead of the New Year's Day fixtures. The New Year also brings with it the ability to play your second wildcard and the General has his thoughts on whether you should play it straight away, plus these questions answered:

Is it worth planning or still live gameweek by gameweek?

 With the Ben Crellin's predictions looking a little underwhelming for DGW22, should our plan be to use transfers to prepare? Or attack it with wildcards and free hits?

 Is it risky to wildcard in GW21 for a Bench Boost in Gameweek 22 with all the postponements at the moment?

If you are on a wildcard for gw21, what are some key players that are must haves? 


 What do we do with Bernardo Silva?

 Replacements for Reece James?

 Goalkeeper strategy? It’s time to move on from Ramsdale, right? De Gea or Lloris? Should we have 2 playing goalies?

 Is it worth a hit to upgrade to Son from Gallagher if we are planning on downgrading James?

 Is now a good time to ship off Smith-Rowe?

 Is the Ronaldo and Kane double up on, if you want to differentiate from going away from Son with the latter due to his high ownership?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Premier League is set to continue throughout the Christmas period despite the ongoing COVID concerns, so the FPL General is here to get you ready for what will hopefully be a busy period of festive fixtures. There's the usual watchlist update, captaincy advice plus these questions answered:

If one still holds the first wildcard, when is the best to play it, GW19 or GW20?

 Is it time to dump double Chelsea defence?

 Is big at the back still a viable strategy? If so, who are the preferred players?

 Is it too much of a knee jerk transfer to get Son in?

 Is Bernardo Silva a hold?

 With Martinelli emerging as another midfield asset, can we go without a Man City midfielder given the rotation risks and stick to nailed assets like Son, Mount, Raphinha etc?

 Is it time to sell ESR or will his game time improve?

 Do we target Ronaldo this gameweek?

 Assuming Salah is your captain, best options for vice-captain if a game is postponed?

 Should we be starting to plan transfers towards potential upcoming DGWs, or stick with week-by-week reactionary transfers given COVID disruption?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Festive Fixtures Preview

items.content:
With an increasing number of Premier League games being postponed due to covid cases, the FPL General tries his best to navigate his way through the uncertainty and assess the most sensible approach for your FPL team right now

With the current situation, would you use any free transfers to try and get as many players out as possible or roll them for whenever things become a little clearer?

 Would you or are you considering Free Hit?

 How many hits are worth taking to field a playing 11?

 What is the best strategy for getting through a Covid filled winter?

 Do we try to keep some blanking players due to future DGWs?

 Is Antonio to Watkins now the most no-brainer transfer in FPL history?

 Is it still worth getting Mason Mount into my FPL team, given he's one of the few options still playing.

Is KDB worth a punt?

 Best replacements for Livramento?

 What's the point? It feels like what you do you're damned if you do or damned if you don't.


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
We've got another midweek round of Premier League fixtures starting on Tuesday, so the FPL General is here to get you up to speed with his usual batch of transfer advice, captaincy choices, an updated watchlist, and these burning questions dealt with:

Stick with King or switch to Dennis?

Best Raphinha replacement - Foden, Bernardo or Bowen?

Bowen or Gallagher?

Is it time to drop the double Chelsea defence?

Who to get rid of first Wilson or Antonio? Is Watkins the top replacement?

Which players should we definitely NOT sell to raise money to get Ronaldo?

Finally lost patience with Vardy. Is he a hold for Spurs? If not, who’s the best option?

Is Dalot a possible Livramento replacement?

Any advice for people who feel like they are just treading water?

Thoughts on triple captaining Salah at home against Newcastle?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The FPL General is here to assess the landscape after gameweek 15 and get you ready to go again before the weekend. There's transfer advice, captaincy picks, a watchlist update and these questions answered:

Rank Sancho, Bruno, Rashford & Ronaldo ahead of United's great fixture run?

Is Dalot worth serious consideration given his price?

If you've kept Kane this long, do you hold for one more week against a depleted Brighton defence or move to Ronaldo ahead of United's good run starting with Norwich?

Is big at the back turning into big in midfield? 

Silva, Foden or Gundogan?

Should we stick with Raphinha or switch to an option like Foden or Bernardo as Leeds fixtures are very tough for the next few gameweeks?

Is it time to say goodbye to Ivan Toney?

Who's fixtures should we be targeting over the Christmas period?

Should we consider Watkins with Villa's great fixtures?

Thoughts on Armando Broja at Southampton?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
It's a quick turnaround to gameweek 15 after a hectic round of midweek fixtures and the FPL General is here to get you set up and ready to go again. There's captaincy picks, transfer advice, a watchlist update and these questions answered:

With most premium defenders getting 2 points or less, is big at the back no more?

What are your thoughts on Alonso?

What to do with Kane? Switch to Ronaldo for United’s great run or downgrade to be able to spread the cash around more?

Given Man City's fixtures, which players should we consider transferring in?

Dennis or King? 

What to do with Antonio? Hold or sell?

Should we be considering the Liverpool double up and finding room for Robertson in a back 4 or 5?

What to do with Bryan Mbuemo?

Should I go for B.Silva or Mount to replace Zaha?

Are you enjoying the fact Salah is almost a perma-captain for most given you've often said removing captaincy is the first change you'd make to FPL?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

It's a quick turnaround this week with the gameweek 14 deadline coming on Tuesday before a full programme of midweek fixtures, so with that in mind the FPL General is armed with transfer advice, captaincy picks, and a watchlist update and answers to these questions:

Do you think people should have a full playing bench given the congested fixtures or can we get away with just 1 or 2 playing subs?

How do you feel about just burning a transfer?

Is Jota a must-own?

 Best replacement for Chilwell? - Reguilon or Alonso or someone else?

 Alonso versus Gallagher. Where do you see better value?

 What do we do with Son and/or Kane?

 Best Mbeumo replacement?

 Is Vardy a hold or sell for Kane/Lukaku?

 What do you think about Maddison after his goal and two assists?

 Is it time to offload Havertz now that Lukaku is back?

items.content:
The FPL General is here with team news ahead of gameweek 13, plus there's transfer advice, his team reveal and these pressing questions answered:

Do you think Alonso is going to start in place of chilwell? 

In light of the Chilwell news, is Dias to Alonso worth the transfer if you already own the other big 3 wing backs?

Assuming Chilwell is injured, is the best back 4 now: TAA, Cancelo, James and Alonso?

With Antonio off form and Reece James ripping it up, is a -4 using funds from Antonio to upgrade Tierney to James a good move?

After blanking in 3 games, is it viable to sell Foden and bring in a cheaper midfielder like Cornet or Gallagher in order to go big at the back?

Son to Jota?

Is Zaha a keep or a sell?

Do you think Benteke will keep up his recent form?

Given the circumstances, do you think playing 4/5 defenders, 4/5 midfielders and 1 up front is the way to go now, at least for a while? 

As a Manchester United fan, what do you think of the new manager? Will it affect your FPL decisions?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
With an action-packed gameweek 12 in the books the FPL General is here to assess the damage and get you ready to go again at the weekend. He's got a watchlist update, transfer and captaincy advice, plus answers to these questions:

If 5 at the back is a genuine option, can we say the Chelsea defensive triple is viable, along with Trent and Cancelo?

 Is Dias to Chilwell a good transfer?

 Antonio has 23 points from his last 9 gameweeks. What striker do we go for now?

 Best under 6.5 forwards? Is Dennis the obvious choice?

Should we trust the fixtures and keep Vardy or just sell him because he is a 2 pts player too frequently recently?

How essential are Son and Kane when we could double up on the Chelsea wing backs for half the price instead?

Are there any decent replacements for Mbeumo around the same price?

Is Raphinha a hold? Or time to move to Jota if he’s fit?

Can we now start to look at Bernardo Silva as a legitimate option?

Is it wise to take an 8 or 12 point hit to steady the ship if my team is a mess, wildcard is played and I'm way down the rankings?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
With the international break over the FPL General is here to get us back in the groove for gameweek 12 as the Premier League returns. There's a watchlist update, captaincy picks, transfer advice plus all these questions answered:

Is Son or Kane a must-own this week or a wait and see until next GW?

Stick or twist with Mbuemo and Toney?

Is Vardy worth keeping, or is it time to downgrade to the likes of Wilson and Jimenez and upgrade in defence or midfield?

If Robertson is injured, is it worth prioritising Tsimikas over Jota as third Liverpool spot?

Best Robert Sanchez replacement?

Reece James or Ben Chillwell?

Who are the differential players you would go for before playing a wildcard in GW15 or 16?

What are your thoughts on Steven Gerrard’s Villa move with regards to FPL?

Is there a case for West Ham's Ben Johnson as a £4.0m defender?

Thoughts on spending big on 4 or 5 premium wing backs on a wildcard this week?

items.content:
With good fixtures and a potential new manager bounce with the arrival of serial winner Antonio Conte, is it time to get in early on Spurs assets? The FPL General rounds up a busy gameweek 10, updates his watchlist and answers these questions:

With Conte to Spurs seeming like a done deal, do we wait a game or two or jump on Spurs assets immediately?

Is it time to sell Raphinha?

Mbuemo to Smith-Rowe or hold for Norwich?

Is it overthinking to sell Antonio just because he has a few difficult fixtures coming up?

Could Antonio to Jimenez be a shrewd move?

 What to do with Vardy?

 Thoughts on bringing in Reece James for Joao Cancelo?

 Thoughts on Ronaldo after his haul at the weekend? Keep or sell?

 Should we go all in on Maxwell Cornet?

 Views on Tyrick Mitchell?

After a wild gameweek and another green arrow, The FPL General gives an update on his watchlist, transfer advice, captaincy picks and these questions answered: 
What's your thoughts on squad structure when we can perma-captain Salah and look to spread funds across the team?
Do we stick or twist with Havertz vs Newcastle?
Is Kovacic a good option as a slightly more expensive 5th midfielder over Brownhill for example, if one has the cash?
What to do with Christensen? 
Is it still worth getting on the Mount train even though I own Foden? 
Best Vardy replacement if he's ruled out? 
Who do you think is the best budget striker to get now? Toney or Hwang?
Is it time to move away from three playing strikers, to invest more in our midfields?
Are the attacking full backs now essential over safe centre halves, even if more at risk of rotation? 
Is it worth starting Foster over Ramsdale/Sanchez this week?

items.content:
The FPL General is here ahead of a Friday deadline for gameweek 9 and the big story this week is Romelu Lukaku's injury, the General explores a range of potential solutions for replacing the Chelsea striker, as well his usual advice on transfers, captaincy and his team reveal.
All that plus these questions answered too:

Is Lukaku to Vardy the only option or should we look at other options for Lukaku replacements? 

Is it worth dropping Lukaku for a -4 if I've already made my transfers for the GW?

With Salah being the only in form premium option at the moment, is it viable to have one premium (Salah) and two 'light premiums' (Vardy and Son)?

Thoughts on Havertz given the Lukaku and Werner injuries?

Do I stick or twist on Ronaldo?

Is Aubameyang a worthwhile differential pick as a Lukaku replacement?

Eight gameweeks in, what are your general thoughts on Grealish as a fantasy asset?

What are your thoughts on a Leicester forward double up and have your thoughts changed since Daka scored 5 goals this week?

What about Edouard as a lower price striker option?

Thoughts on Jiminez as a captaincy punt against leaky Leeds?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

The FPL General is here ahead of a Friday deadline for gameweek 9 and the big story this week is Romelu Lukaku's injury, the General explores a range of potential solutions for replacing the Chelsea striker, as well his usual advice on transfers, captaincy and his team reveal.
All that plus these questions answered too:

Is Lukaku to Vardy the only option or should we look at other options for Lukaku replacements? 
Is it worth dropping Lukaku for a -4 if I've already made my transfers for the GW?

items.title: FPL Friday: Solutions for injured Lukaku

items.content:
The FPL General looks ahead to gameweek 9, fresh off the back of picking up a green arrow in GW8. He's got an updated watch list, transfer advice, captaincy picks and these questions answered:

Lukaku. Stick or twist?!

Do I do Ronaldo to Lukaku or to Vardy?

Do we need to get Son now, or wait until his fixtures get better?

When (if at all) do we jump to Kane? Ron and Rom not really doing it

Is it time to start jumping off the West Ham assets?

Brought in Dias and Christensen on the wildcard, with *mixed* results. Are either of them a hold for this week?

I fear Greenwood will unfairly become Ole’s fall guy for United’s unbalanced team - hold on to him or switch now to avoid rotation risk?

Is it worth a punt on Werner?

I would consider Ings as unjustifiably underrated. His numbers compared to his price are great. Fixtures are ok. What am I missing? 

Thoughts on triple Brentford?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Lukaku - stick or twist?

items.content:
The FPL General has activated his wildcard and he's here with an update on his latest draft ahead of Saturday morning's GW8 deadline.
He's tuned in to all the press conferences so has the latest team news to help you make those all important captaincy and transfer decisions, plus answers these questions:

Is Trent a must have despite the fixtures Liverpool have?

Is a move to a city defender a good use of 1 FT this GW?

If Rüdiger is confirmed out do I go straight to TAA or hold off until GW10?

Chilwell over Rudiger on wildcard?

Should we get five premiums at the back (TAA, 2 city, 2 chelsea) as they can be good value for money for the upcoming gameweeks?

Very tempted by Mason Mount on WC. Would you go there?

Do you keep or get rid of Antonio on a wildcard and go with double brentford attack?

Is KDB a viable option for his price tag this season?

Is it time to move Ronaldo on for Lukaku? Or go for someone like Vardy who is in form?

Is Mason Greenwood still worth having?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: FPL Friday: WILDCARD ACTIVATED

items.content:
The FPL General is back from his international break hiatus and ready to hit the ground running in search of those precious green arrows. He's got captaincy picks, transfer advice, a watchlist update, his latest thoughts on a wildcard and answers these questions:

Is Trent still worth the money or is it better to spread the extra £1.5m on a double double up of City and Chelsea defenders?

Do we keep or sell Antonio?

Is Alonso or Chilwell viable and worth the potential upside with strongish bench options (Livramento/White)?

Is Vardy a better option than Lukaku now?

With Pep roulette are Ederson & Dias a good City defence double up?

Is KDB being overlooked as a viable premium asset? 

Foden or Grealish?

Best front three on a wildcard?

Now that Hwang seems to have secured a starting spot alongside Jimenez, is he a good placeholder for a couple of weeks before turning to Toney in Gameweek 10?

What are the best GW8 one-week punts for those of us wildcarding in GW9?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: FPL Friday: what to do with injured Trent Alexander-Arnold?

items.content:
The FPL General reviews a disappointing gameweek for Ronaldo, Bruno Fernandes and Lukaku owners and looks ahead with renewed optimism to gameweek 6. There's the usual take on captaincy picks, transfer advice, a watchlist update, plus these questions answered:

Double Chelsea defence or 1 Chelsea and 1 City for next 5 GWs?

If you would wildcard this gameweek, what would your team be like?

Reasons to wait until gw8 for wc and not this week?

Is a missing / misfiring Chelsea midfield going to damage Lukaku's points potential?

Would you stick with Sanchez or go for Ramsdale assuming he is first choice now?

Is Saka a viable option over Sarr, looking at Watford's tougher fixtures and Arsenal's form turnaround?

What are your thoughts on Aston Villa defenders?

Do you feel comfortable going with Gallagher to fit in Ronaldo and Lukaku?

If you owned both Jota and Greenwood, which one would you be looking to move on first and is GW7 to right time to sell?

Best one week punt (any position, any price) before GW8 wildcard?

items.title: FPL Friday - 10 quickfire questions before the Friday deadline

items.content:
The FPL General rounds up all the action from gameweek 4 and gives you his take on best captaincy picks and transfers for GW5. Plus there's his watchlist update and these questions answered:

With Antonio suspended and DCL not projected to return until GW7, is it time to get either of the Wolves forwards, Bamford, or even Ings?

Antonio - keep for form and future fixtures, even if we have threadbare benches and may need to play someone like Brownhill and end up with no viable subs this week, or change to Bamford?

Who is the best replacement for DCL?

Do you think Salah, Ronaldo and Lukaku in the team is a viable option?

If wildcarding this week, would you fade, Ronaldo for Lukaku?

Who is the best Wolves option in defence?

Is it time to offload Benrahma, particularly for the likes of Gray?

Is Conor Gallagher now a legitimate enabler or a trap?

Any love for Pukki as a replacement for the underperforming Toney?

Do you think Ramsdale could be worth inclusion if you're playing a wildcard?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The FPL General is back with a look ahead to the resumption of the Premier League, he's got his usual watchlist update, advice on captaincy and transfers, plus these questions answered:

If there’s a number of players with issues coming back from international break (say 4-5 were flagged), would you wildcard or ride it out for a week?

Is a wildcard a worthy consideration at this point if you have a FT and thinking only 2/3 changes to your squad, better taking the hit on points?

 Is Ronaldo value for £12.5m vs the mid-priced forwards?

 Does Ronaldo help or hinder Man United's other assets such as Greenwood and Bruno?

 What's your view on Ronaldo for a hit?

 Could you rank these forwards? Antonio, DCL, Jimenez, Bamford.

 How do you rank Jota, Greenwood and Torres as options from this Gameweek onwards?

 Is Ismaila Sarr being overlooked as a downgrade to fund Ronaldo?

 Are we overlooking Spurs assets?

 Best GK options for those on wildcard?

items.title: FPL Friday: last minute GW1 tips

items.content:
With just a matter of days to go until the first FPL deadline of the season the FPL General is here with his all important golden rules to make sure you stay on track for a good season, he also takes you through his thoughts on captaincy choices for the first six gameweeks, and there's his all important first gameweek draft...
All that plus these listener questions asked:

With emerging £4.0m defenders like Tsimikas and Amartey who could offer the same points as the big hitting defenders in the first few weeks, is it wise to go for cheap defenders and big on mids and forwards?

How important is a strong bench? 

Why is Ings still an attractive asset?

Do you think a downgrade from Bruno to Sancho would be worth it to fit in Lukaku?

Can we go without Raphinha for the first 4? 

What do you think about the Everton defence and especially Lucas Digne, is he worth £5.5m for the start of the season? 

Would you be happy with Sanchez/Bachmann or a 4.5 keeper, or would you stretch to a 5/5.5 keeper?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The FPL General's Golden Rules + his latest GW1 draft

items.content:
New name, same FPL General - he's back with 11 days to go before the first deadline of the season with ten tips for success this season, plus the usual selection of burning questions from our listeners:

Is it worth starting with a Chelsea and a City player so that you don't need to book transfers in early doors?

How will you consider Kane for GW2 at home to Norwich if he moves to and trains with Man City before the GW1 deadline?

As no player is "essential", how "necessary" is Bruno?

Raphinha aside, who would you have if the season started tomorrow?

Is Smith-Rowe a viable enabler or a transfer waiting to happen?

Is 4 at the back a viable strategy?

How many non-playing bench players would you advise for the start of the season?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Strategies to save your season & plan for double gameweek 35

items.content:
In advance of GW34, The General reflects on Bruno Fernandes' downturn in recent form and answers the following questions:

Is this a good week to bank a transfer?

Is Diogo Jota worth holding onto?

Given Everton's promising fixtures - which Blues defender, midfielder & attacker would you pick with an unlimited budget?

How do you get over a disappointing week, when you know you have a good squad?

Should I get Harry Kane back? Even for a -4?

Has Illan Meslier become a legitimate GK option for the run-in?

What's the best advice you'd give to managers who still have a wildcard left to play!?

items.title: The General & A Prince

items.content:
The General returns, with a green arrow in sight, to help us navigate Gameweek 33, The EFL Cup Final and beyond. Will he resist the urge to pick up Lingard AGAIN this week and answers to the following:

Is it time to return to Emi Martinez with our tails between our legs?

Who is the best replacement for the injured Lacazette?

Should you hold onto Son now that Mourinho is gone?

Should you play your free hit this weekend if you still have it?

Which disposable template players and which differentials could replace them to make up ground in mini-leagues?

Who should our 3rd striker be, presuming Iheanacho and Kane are everyone's other two!

Who are the top 5 defenders to own right now?

What's the strategy for potential upcoming double and blank gameweeks?

items.title: Gameweek 33 Preview: Shackles Off For Mourinho-Less Spurs?

items.content:
The General is back to preview an extended gameweek 32, still haunted by wildcard sales of the recent past, as Jesse Lingard becomes officially impossible to ignore and Kai Havertz starts to show his class at Chelsea... Mark reveals his plan to break into the top 10k by the end of the season... And of course, answers to the following:

Is Kane a good triple captain option for this week & Is Son essential for the Spurs double?

Is it worth bringing in Iheanacho before his FA Cup tie?

Were the last couple of Chelsea matches just defensive blips?

Is Edinson Cavani worth it?

Emi Martinez over Edouard Mendy?

How best to use your free hit if you still have one?

And, will The General revert to a more conservative strategy from now until the end of the season after breaking some of his own golden rules?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Long Gameweek 32 & Eye-Catching Kai Havertz

items.content:
The General is in a defiant mood after triggering his wildcard early but still has some sage advice for those of you who've patiently waited for Gameweek 31 to play it. A Liverpool revival continues to entice, as does the form of West Ham's Jesse Lingard, plus a totally re-imagined watchlist and answers to the following:

Is Kane a set-and-forget captain until the end of the season?

Any advice for GW31 Wildcarders?

KDB, Fernandes, Salah & Kane - Drop one!

How many Liverpool players do we need after their performance against Arsenal?

Is Ederson the safest defensive Man City pick?

Can we trust either Wolves or Arsenal defenders?

Who is the best differential wildcard DF, MF and FW option?

Marcos Alonso - stick or twist given recent game time?

And how do you feel about Iheanacho now?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Messi Lingard & Wildcard Advice for Gameweek 31

items.content:
Fantasy Premier League returns in Gameweek 30 with The General grateful to the international break for being able to enjoy a Sunday without any red arrows and to refocus on the final stretch... Why Arsenal's Martin Odegaard is a better player than an FPL player, a 'fling' with Marcos Alonso, as well as answers to the following:

What to do with Man City assets now they *basically* have the Premier League all wrapped up?

Keep Bale and Son for Newcastle away?

Are Leeds' assets like Raphinha and Bamford worth keeping beyond GW30?

Who is the best one-week transfer if you plan on wildcarding in GW31?

Who are the best midfield options currently at £7.5m and under?

Pedro Neto's upcoming fixtures look good - is he worth a punt? 

And, if you could have done one thing differently, what would it have been?

Why Arsenal's Martin Odegaard is a better player than an FPL player, a 'fling' with Marcos Alonso, as well as answers to the following:

What to do with Man City assets now they *basically* have the Premier League all wrapped up?

Keep Bale and Son for Newcastle away?

Are Leeds' assets like Raphinha and Bamford worth keeping beyond GW30?

Who is the best one-week transfer if you plan on wildcarding in GW31?

Who are the best midfield options currently at £7.5m and under?

Pedro Neto's upcoming fixtures look good - is he worth a punt? 

And, if you could have done one thing differently, what would it have been?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Gameweek 30 & The Wildcard 'Essentials'

items.content:
With just the four fixtures for the FPL General to mull over as the dreaded blank Gameweek 29 approaches, he reveals why Arsenal left-back Kieran Tierney is a good option for the short and long-term... He also debates a one-week-punt on Leandro Trossard and whether "value-buy" Iheanacho will he make his wildcard squad?
Plus, answers to the following twitter questions:

What is a reasonable amount of hits to take this week?

How do you handle multiple injuries in your squad?

Who are the top 5 players to target?

Is Lingard the best available Salah replacement for this GW?

Is it a good idea to play a wildcard during the international break?

Which differential players are you eyeing up?

... And are Man City, Everton and Villa assets all now worth selling?

items.title: Dealing with a BAD Gameweek + Why we're loyal to Salah?

items.content:
The FPL General is back and eager to move on quickly from a historic double gameweek - which failed to live up to expectations... Fortunately Gameweek 27 is upon us and some big questions need to be answered, that is, if you can all stop looking ahead to 'blank gameweek 29' of course!
Qs:
Is it time to replace Bruno Fernandes ahead of a tough run of games for Manchester United?
Is a Spurs triple-up a good option for the remainder of the season?
Would it be wise to focus all our attention on the upcoming blank Gameweek 29?
A Brighton defender or Michail Antonio?
Best Harvey Barnes replacements for similar money or less?
Are City's fringe players like Mahrez, Foden & Jesus becoming a good option?
Who are the best defenders for £4.5m or less?
And is Alex McCarthy actually worth keeping?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: How to tackle double gameweek 19 now that the fixtures have changed

items.content:
The FPL General is here to provide guidance on how best to navigate the increasingly disrupted and unpredictable FPL schedule
Plenty of captaincy & transfer advice, the usual watchlist update, plus these questions answered:

Should we fill our free-hit squads with differentials?

Does it make sense to play free-hit if there are only 5 games being played?

Do you enjoy how chaotic this FPL season has become or long for a return to normality?

Is it best to save your chips for later in the season when the covid postponements have calmed down?

If I use two free transfers now and then free-hit a day later will my free transfers remain or be cancelled?

Lacazette or Martial for free-hit squads?

Who are the top differentials for GW 18?

Is it worth taking a points hit to get 9 players for GW18 enabling us to keep our free-hit chip for later in the season?

With all the postponements is the wildcard becoming more of an option for those of us who used our first wildcard early?

Are triple-ups too risky this season with all the potential postponements?

Double gameweek19 - to bench boost or not?

Is KDB a trap?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Navigating the disruption + best differential options for GW18

items.content:
The FPL General is here to pick up the pieces after a disrupted gameweek 16 that saw two games postponed and some big players left pointless.
He's got all the usual advice on captaincy picks, transfer plans, watchlist update, plus all your questions answered, a lot with the upcoming blank and double gameweeks in mind...

Would you say it's better to wait until the last minute to make transfers and ignore price changes?

Is it still worth planning to bench boost in GW19 given the postponements we saw this week?

Who's the best 4.4 million or less defender?

Is using our free hit chip in gw18 now a waste with more double gameweeks to come?

What are your thoughts on Meslier for the double gameweek?

Would you go double Leeds attack?

Is Michail Antonio worth a gamble for double gameweek 19?

Are you scaling back your forward planning and only looking two or three weeks ahead?

Is the lesson from the last few days to make sure we have a strong bench?

Is Rashford a better option than Son?

He's got all the usual advice on captaincy picks, transfer plans, watchlist update, plus all your questions answered, a lot with the upcoming blank and double gameweeks in mind...

Would you say it's better to wait until the last minute to make transfers and ignore price changes?

Is it still worth planning to bench boost in GW19 given the postponements we saw this week?

Who's the best 4.4 million or less defender?

Is it worth taking hits to bring in players for the double gameweek 19?

Is using our free hit chip in gw18 now a waste with more double gameweeks to come?

What are your thoughts on Meslier for the double gameweek?

Would you go double Leeds attack?

Is Michail Antonio worth a gamble for double gameweek 19?

Are you scaling back your forward planning and only looking two or three weeks ahead?

Is the lesson from the last few days to make sure we have a strong bench?

Is Rashford a better option than Son?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

In order of priority for double gameweek 16, how do you rank KDB, Salah, Son and Bruno?

Is new info about double gameweek 26 changing your chip strategy?

Which players are essential on a gameweek 16 wildcard?

Is now a good time to go for a Robertson and Alexander-Arnold double-up?

Do the fixtures of Spurs, Liverpool and West Ham lend themselves to a wildcard before gameweek 15?

Who are the best Chilwell replacements?

items.title: Planning ahead for double gameweek 19

items.content:
The FPL General looks ahead to the midweek Premier League fixtures with advice on the best captaincy options - will it be KDB or Bruno Fernandes? Remember that this week's FPL deadline is on Tuesday at 16:30!
There's also more transfer advice, a watchlist update, review of GW 12, plus these questions answered:

Has the return of home crowds had an impact on team performance?

Is Soucek a viable starter now?

Who is the best option to replace Jota?

Is John Stones a good price for a gamble or should we stick with Dias or Walker?

Advice for using the bench boost chip?

Is it time to sell Ollie Watkins?

Who are the best Fulham differentials?

Do we need to have both Kane & Son for the rest of the season?

Are there any teams that you refuse to sign players from?

Should I hold Vardy for the upcoming Everton game?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Midweek fixtures preview - who's best captain KDB or Bruno?

items.content:
The FPL General drops his weekly dose of wisdom as we look ahead to gameweek 12 of the FPL season, including his thoughts on whether Mohammed Salah is the must-have captaincy option this week, plus his usual watchlist update, transfer advice and the following questions answered:
Is it worth dropping De Bruyne for Salah this week?
Who are your preferred sub 4.5 million defenders?
Would I be stupid to sell Ramsdale now after having him since GW1?
Is the goalscoring rate of Zouma and Vestergaard sustainable?
Is Son a must own at his current price?
Should we keep the faith in Jota or spend the cash on Trent instead?
Is it safe to go Bruno, KDB, Salah and Son in midfield?
Are Reece James and Chilwell the new Trent and Robertson?
How would you rank the premium assets through to GW15?
Who is a differential risk to target before a wilcard in GW16?

For this week's partnership go to www.virginwines.co.uk/theathletic
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Is Salah the must-have captain this week?

items.content:
The FPL General is back to preview gameweek 10 and send his weekly wisdom your way. We've got a watchlist update, captaincy and transfer advice, plus these questions answered:

- Who are the Man City assets least likely to be rotated?
- Is James Rodriguez done? Time to swap him for KDB?
- Who is the best 4.5 defender for the next five fixtures?
- Is it worth a points hit to get Bruno, Salah and KDB?
- Ziyech is good, but is he FPL good?
- Is Diogo Jota worth playing as the 5th midfielder in a 3-5-2?
- Who's the best cheap replacement for Harry Kane?
- Would you consider triple captaining KDB against Fulham?
- Should we pick a 'set and forget' captain? Should it be Bruno?
- Should we settle for Mahrez if we can't afford KDB without taking a hit?

Should we be considering Man City defenders?

items.content:
The FPL General previews gameweek 6 and gives you his take on what to do with your Liverpool defenders after the news of Virgil Van Dijk's serious injury. Should you stick with previously reliable assets like Alexander-Arnold and Robertson? Could Gomez or Matip be worth picking up? Or does Virgil's absence make them all too unreliable? Enquire within and the General will give you his considered opinion as always.
Elsewhere he looks at the viability of Harry Kane v Sergio Aguero, which Villa midfielder to go for, and gives you his view on whether Dominic Calvert-Lewin's form will continue long enough to get him if you haven't already.
FPL is increasingly having a negative impact on some people's mental health so the General gives you his tips on how to play the game and keep it fun without letting it take over your life.

Subscribe to The Athletic for access to exclusive columns and Q&As from the FPL General - head to theathletic.com/fplpod to sign up for just £1-a-month

itunes.author: The Athletic
itunes.subtitle: Your go-to FPL podcast for expert tips and tricks
itunes.summary:
The Athletic's Fantasy Premier League expert Mark McGettigan - aka FPL General - gets straight to the point and tells you what you need to know if you want to be a successful FPL manager.
Transfer advice, captaincy picks, a regularly updated watchlist, this is the pod for you if you want to rise to the top of your mini league and stay there.

title: The Athletic FPL Podcast
